text:
In these videos, I hope to teach you some
basic English.
So these videos are for low level beginners.

Now when you watch these videos, I want you
to pay attention.
Watch all the videos in the series.

Please listen carefully and if there are any
words or expressions that you don’t know,

Another thing you should do is repeat after
me.
Repeating is a really good practice.
So, I know that some of these videos are hard.

If you try your best, and watch all of these
videos, I know that your English will get
Hi, everybody and welcome to this video.

Now in this video, I want to talk about the
difference between consonants and vowels.

Now, in the English alphabet, there are twenty-six
letters.

And in the alphabet, there are five main vowels
and one special vowel.
So, let’s look at the board.
The first letter, ‘a’, is a vowel.
The next letter, ‘b’, is a consonant.
And we’ll talk about that more later on.

And ‘z’ is the last letter and it is a
consonant.

Okay, so, there are twenty-six letters in
the alphabet.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Now all English words have vowels.
So, let’s look at these words.
Okay, we have ‘c’ is a consonant.

So we have the main vowels: ‘a’, ’e
’,’i’ ,’o’ ,’u’.
Now, I said ‘y’ is a special vowel.

That’s because sometimes it’s a vowel
and sometimes it’s a consonant.

In the word, “why”, the letter ‘y’
sounds like ‘i’.

‘i’ is the letter ‘i’ right, it sounds
like the letter ‘i’.
So, in this case ‘y’ is also a vowel.

Now, in the last two words, “you” and
“yes”, the letter ‘y’ is a consonant.

Usually, if ‘y’ comes at the beginning
of a word, or if it makes a /u/ sound, for

Now to help us remember vowels, we can say,
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
“a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y.”
Okay, and that’s the end of this video.
Hi everybody and welcome to this video.

In this video, we’re going to talk about
using ‘a’ or ‘an’.
We use ‘a’ or ‘an’ in front of nouns.
A noun is a person, place, thing or animal.
Okay, so let’s look at the board.
The first noun we have is “banana”.

In this case, the first letter is ‘a’.
‘a’ is a vowel.

Remember the vowels are a, e, i, o, u, so
we have to put ‘an’.
The first letter, ‘c’, is a consonant.

Remember, if it’s a consonant, we have to
put ‘a’.
Again, the word starts with a consonant: ‘b’.
So we have to say, “a boy”.

The next word, “egg”, has the letter ‘e’
in front.
If we read it, it sounds like “an egg.”
Okay, and the last word is “ant”.
So again, we must put……”an ant”.
Now, let’s go through these words together.

Keep in mind that when you have ‘an’ in
front, it has to sound like almost one word.
Let’s move on the next part.
Okay, let’s do some extra practice.
Ahhh, I have some nouns on the board.

Remember, a noun is a person, place, thing
or animal.
So let’s go through them one by one.
It’s a thing that we read.

Umbrella is a thing that we use when it’s
raining.
Orange is a thing that we eat.

Now, I’m going to say ‘a’ or ‘an’
in front of the nouns.

I want you to listen and see if you can hear
the difference.
In that case we say, “a book”.

Remember, we put ‘a’ in front of words
that begin with consonants.
That’s why we say, “a book”, “a park”.

We say ‘an’ because umbrella starts with
a vowel: ‘u’.
Again, elephant starts with a vowel.

Again, we have to say, “an orange” because
‘o’ is a vowel.

So, let’s go through each word one more
time.
Notice it sounds like one word.
So that’s the end of this video.

I hope you can remember when to use ‘a’
and ‘an’.
Hi, everybody and welcome to this video.

Now, in this lesson I’m going to talk about
singular and plural nouns.
And plural means more than one or many.
So let’s look at the board.
This part is showing singular nouns.

So when the noun is singular, we put ‘a’
or ‘an’.
Now over here, we have plural nouns.
Two, three, four, and so on.

So, when we have a plural noun we have to,
don’t forget, we have to put ‘s’ or

Again, if there’s more than one, if the
noun is plural, you have to put ‘s’ or

Now the nouns here, you just have to add an
‘s’.

Okay, and we’re going to go through them
right now.
Okay, you must not forget that.
I really need you to remember that.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, now we have some more nouns.
These nouns are a little bit different.
Uhhh, when they’re singular it’s the same.

But when you want to make them plural, you
have to add ‘es’.

Remember, I said, you can add ‘s’ or ‘es’
to make a noun plural…more than one.
So again, these nouns you have to add ‘es’.
So let’s go through them one more time.
Now, we’re going to move on to the plural.

Remember, again, to make the plural, or more
than one, here, we add ‘es’.

We have to put ‘es’ to make these nouns
plural.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

So, how do we know if we should put ‘s’
or ‘es’ to make the noun plural?

Well, for most nouns, you just have to put
‘s’.
But, for some, you have to put ‘es’.
Well… let’s look at the board.

So if the noun ends in ‘ch’, you have
to put ‘es’.

So again, if the noun ends in ‘ch’, add
‘es’ at the end to make it plural.
The same goes for the next word “brush”.

So if it ends in ‘sh’, same thing, we
add ‘es’ at the end to make it plural.
We have the letter ‘x’ at the end.

All nouns that end in ‘x’, we have to
put ‘es’ to make it plural.
If the noun ends with these, put ‘es’.
Okay, we have ‘ss’ at the end.
Put ‘es’ at the end to make it plural.
Again, if it ends in ‘ss’ put ‘es’.

Okay, so please, don’t forget ‘ch’,
‘sh’, ‘x’, ‘ss’, we must put ‘es’
Most of the other nouns we just add ‘s’.
Now we have some special nouns on this side.

Now, most nouns that end in ‘o’, like
“photo”, all we have to do is add an ‘s’

But these are special because we actually
have to put ‘es’ at the end… to make
Again, these are a little bit special.

For most nouns that end in ‘o’, we just
add ‘s’.
Okay, and, uhhh, let’s go to the final part.
Okay, let’s do some extra practice.
On the board, I have some nouns.
Some are singular and some are plural.

We have to decide together if we should put
‘s’ or ‘es’ or make them singular.

So you have to listen carefully and remember
what we learned in this video.
So again the plural is “three classes”.
Do we have to put anything?
No ‘s’ or ‘es’ because this is singular.
And the last one is “one bat”.

We do not put an ‘s’ or ‘es’ because
again, it’s just one.
We don’t have to put anything after ‘bat’.

Okay, so, in this video, we learned how to
make a noun singular.
And how to make a noun plural.

And remember, don’t forget, we have to put
‘s’ or ‘es’.
That’s the end of this video.
Hi everybody and welcome to this video.

In this video, we’re going to talk about
subjective pronouns.
So, let’s take a look at the board.
So, the first subjective pronoun is ‘I’.
Now, “he” is only used for boys or men.
So another boy or man is “he”.
“She” is used for girls or women.

“It” is used for a place like a school,
an animal like a dog, or a thing like a chair.

For example, “I sing”, “you sing”,
then “we sing”.

“They” means many people, places, animals
or things.

If there’s more than one, we use the subjective
pronoun ‘they’.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

Okay, so let’s practice together with subjective
pronouns.

The first sentence on the board says, “Jenny
sings”.
So we have to say, “he sings”.

The last sentence says, “Jenny and Jack
sing”.
Now Jenny and Jack are two people.
So we have to say, “they sing”.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, let’s do some more practice.

The first sentence on the board says, “The
cat runs”.

‘The cat’ is an animal, so we have to
say, “It runs”.

The next sentence says, “The dog and cat
run”.
Now, ‘the dog and cat’, they are two animals.

So anytime you have two or more things, we
say, “They run”.

Okay, now, for the last sentence, I’m going
to talk about my cat, Ongee.
Let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, here are some more examples.

But, this time, you have to figure out the
subjective pronoun together with me.
They’re people and there’s more than one.

So we have to use the subjective pronoun,
‘they’.
We have to use the subjective pronoun, ‘he’.
Let’s move on to some more examples.

Okay, the first example says, “Seoul is
a city”.

So we have to use the subjective pronoun,
‘it’.

The next example says, “My parents love
Ongee”.
Well, ‘my parents’, they are two people.

The last example is very similar to the second
one.
The difference is… it says, “and I”.

Okay, so, in this video we learned about subjective
pronouns.

I hope you guys have a good understanding
of ‘when’ and ‘how’ to use them.

Thank you for watching and I’ll see you
guys next time.

Now, in this video, we’re going to talk
about subjective pronouns, ‘be’ verbs,
So let’s take a look at the board.
First, we have the subjective pronouns.

And we have the ‘be’ verbs: am, is and
are.
So let’s look at the first one.

Now, a contraction is a more common way of
saying subjective pronouns and their ‘be’
It’s faster and quicker and shorter.
I want you to use contractions.
Okay, let’s move on to the bottom.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

We’re going to take a look at some sentences
using the ‘be’ verbs.
Now, notice on the board, I only used contractions.

For example, instead of “I am”, I’m
going to say “I’m”.
So we have to say “a student”.

Now many people make the mistake of saying,
“I’m student”, but that’s wrong.
Before I read it, you have to listen carefully.

Okay, the next one, again, sounds like one
word.

Now remember, ‘it’ is only used for a
place, a thing or an animal.
So we can’t have those things be a student.
So we have to say, “It’s a dog”.

We took out the ‘a’ and we put an ‘s’
because ‘we’re’ means many people.
Not one student, but many students.
So, we have to say, “we’re students”.

Again, ‘they’ means many people…or many
things.
Okay, we’re going to look at some more examples.
Let’s start with the first one: “I’m”.

Well I hope that this video helped you understand
how to use subjective pronouns, their ‘be’

Now, before we go, I wanted to share a little
bit about myself using the lesson.

Now, the word ‘American’ starts with the
vowel ‘a’, so we have to say ‘an’.

‘Animal’ starts with the vowel ‘a’,
so we have to put ‘an’.
And that means someone who loves animals.
I love dogs and cats and other animals.
Well, that’s it and thank you for watching.
And I’ll see you guys next time.

In this video, we’re going to talk about
subjective pronouns, ‘be’ verbs, and how
to use them with the word ‘not’.
So, let’s look at the board to help us out.

Now the first sentence says, “I’m not
a student”.
I go to school and I learn.

“I’m a teacher” or “No, I’m not
a student”.

Now, notice, we first have the subjective
pronoun and the ‘be’ verb.
And then we have the noun.
Okay, let’s look at the next one.

Remember, ‘it’ is used for place, thing
or animal.
Okay, the next one is a little bit different.
Now, remember, ‘we’ means more than one.

We put an ‘s’ and we don’t put an ‘a’
in front.
Okay, we’re going to look at some more examples.

I want you to listen carefully and repeat
after the examples.
Let’s start with the first one.

“You’re not a singer”
“You’re not a singer”.

Okay, so in this video, we learned how to
use subjective pronouns with the ‘be’
verb and how to use them with the word ‘not’.

So, I wrote some sentences about myself using
what we learned.
So that was a little bit about me.

Thanks for watching and I’ll see you guys
next time.

In this video, I’m going to talk about how
to make questions using subjective pronouns
So, let’s take a look at the board.

Remember, “I’m” is just a contraction
for “I am”.

Now when we want to make a question, we just
have to make a simple change.

All you have to do is put the ‘be’ verb
in the front.
The ‘be’ verb comes in the front.
I also want you to listen to my intonation.
When I say it in a sentence, “I’m a student”.
Okay, then when I say it in a question.
Notice my intonation goes up for the question.

Okay, now there are two possible answers for
this question.
The answers you can say are:
We’re going to look at some more examples.
Please make sure you repeat after each example.
Let’s look at the first one.

Now, we’re going to talk about “he is”
and “she is” and how to use them in questions.
So let’s look at the sentence on the board.

Remember, “he’s” and “she’s” are
contractions for “he is” and “she is”.

So, when we make a question, we have to move
the ‘be’ verb to the front.
So we put ‘is’ in the front.
Just put the ‘be’ verb in the front.

Now I want you to listen to the intonation
again.

In the question, again, the intonation goes
up.

Now when you answer, they are several possible
answers you can give.

When you come to know, this is where it gets
a little tricky, but you can do it.

Okay, “isn’t” is a contraction for “is
not”.

Okay, so you can use “she isn’t”, “he
isn’t”.

Another answer you can give is “No, he’s
not”.

You already know this is a contraction for
‘he is’ and ‘she is’.
And they’re both ok to use.

So, remember, we can give two different answers
for ‘no’.

Alright, now we’re going to look at some
more examples.
Please make sure you repeat after each example.
Now, we’re going to move on to ‘it is’.
And how to use that in a question.
So, let’s look at the board.

Remember, “it’s” is a contraction for
“it is”.

When we make a question, remember, we have
to put the ‘be’ verb in the front.
The intonation goes up for the question.
Now, there are several answer you can give.
The first one is “Yes, it is”.
When you say “no”, you can give two answers.

Remember, “isn’t” is a contraction for
“is not”.
We can also say “No, it’s not”.

So again, remember, we have these two answers
for ‘no’, but they’re both common and
they’re both ok to use when you say “no”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.

Please make sure you follow and repeat after
each one.

Now, we’re going to move on to “you are”
and put that in a question.
On the board the sentence says.

Remember, “you’re” is a contraction
for “you are”.

So we have to put that in the front of the
question.
When we answer, it’s very simple.

We can say, “Yes, I am” or “No, I’m
not”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.
Please follow and repeat after each one.

Now, let’s talk about “we are” and how
to use that in a question.
So the sentence here says, “We’re teachers”.

So the ‘be’ verb ‘are’ goes in the
front.
When we answer, we can say several things.
Or we can say, “No, we’re not”.

And you know “We’re” is a contraction
for “we are”.
We’re going to look at some more examples.

Now, we’re moving on to ‘they are’ in
a question.

The sentence on the board says, “They’re
friends”.

Remember, ‘They’re’ is a contraction
for ‘they are’.

The ‘b’ verb ‘are’ goes in the front
of the question.

Now when we answer, we can say, “Yes, they
are”.
Or, we can say, “No, they aren’t”.

The last thing we can say is “No, they’re
not”.
These two answers for ‘no’ are both correct.
So you can say either one.

We’re going to look at some more examples
now.

Remember, when you’re making a question,
you have to put the ‘b’ verb in the beginning.

This means there is more than one.
So, what do we have to do?

We have to put an ‘s’ to show there’s

Now, for the subjective pronoun ‘you’,
we have to have the ‘be’ verb ‘are’.

So not “You isn’t a cat”, but “You

It’s one thing, so I have to say ‘a’.
“a watch.”

We have more than one, so we have to say “are”.
And we have to put an ‘s’ at the end.

Again, we can use a contraction for ‘they

We’re going to look at some examples and

English speakers speak very quickly, so you

In this video, we’re going to talk about
‘this’ and ‘that’.

Now ‘this’ and ‘that’ are used to
talk about nouns that are close to us, near
So let’s look at the board.

Okay, we use ‘this’ to talk about one
noun, “a flower”, that is close.

Okay, we use ‘that’ to talk about one
noun that’s far away.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
So we have to use the negative.

It’s close by, but it isn’t a flower.
‘isn’t’ is a contraction for ‘is not’.
It’s far away, so we say “that”.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.

Okay, now we’re going to learn how to use
‘this’ and ‘that’ in a question.
So we know “This is a flower”.
When we make a question, we have to switch.
So it becomes, “Is this a flower?”.
So the answer is, “Yes, it is”.

Okay, so we learned ‘this’ and ‘that’
in this video.

I hope you guys understand and I’ll see
you in the next video.
Hi, everybody and welcome to this video.

We’re going to talk about how to use ‘these’
and ‘those’.

Uhhh, just like we learned with ‘this’
and ‘that’, we use ‘these’ and ‘those’

to talk about nouns that are close to us or
far from us.
So, let’s take a look at the board.

Now, we know if there is just one, and it’s
close to us, we say, “This is a flower”.

Now, I change the ‘be’ verb to ‘are’
and I added an ‘s’ at the end of ‘flower’.
Now, there’s one that’s far away.
But, again, there’s more than one.

“There are two flowers”
So, in that case, we use, “Those are flowers.”
Let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, so we know “These are flowers”.

And for the flowers that are far away, we
say, “Those are flowers”.
So, we have to use the negative.

We use the contraction ‘aren’t’ which
is short for ‘are not’.

Okay, and for the chairs that are far away,
we say, “Those aren’t flowers”.
Okay, and let’s try with the markers.
Okay, let’s move on to the next part.
Okay, now we’re going to make some questions.

When you want to make a question, you have
to change ‘these are’ and put the ‘be’
And the answer is “Yes, they are.”
Okay, now the flowers are far away.
And again, the answer is “Yes, they are.”
And again, the answer is “No, they aren’t.”

Okay, so in this video, we learned how to
use ‘these’ and ‘those’.

I hope you guys understand and I’ll see

In this video, we’re going to learn about
possessive adjectives.

We use possessive adjectives to show that
something belongs to me or something belongs
I own something or someone owns something.
So let’s take a look at the board.

Now last time we learned about subjective
pronouns and here they are.
And here are the possessive adjectives.

We use ‘my’ to show that something belongs
to me.

This means that something belongs to one man
or one boy.

We use that to show something belongs to one
woman or one girl.

We use ‘its’ to show that something belongs
to an animal.

We use ‘your’ to show that something belongs
to you.

‘Our’ means that something belongs to
me and you or me and somebody else.
Okay, or me and other people.

We use ‘their’ to show that something
belongs to many people.
Okay, not me, but many people.

Okay, now I want you to pay attention to three
special words.

Now I want you to notice these words sound
like other words.

So you have to be careful not to get them
confused.

‘Its’ sounds like the contraction for
‘it is’; ‘it’s’.
Okay, so, don’t get that confused.

‘Your’ sounds like the contraction for
‘you are’ ‘you’re’.
So make sure you use this one to show possession.

And the last word, ‘their’, it actually
sounds like two other words.

The contraction for ‘they are’ ‘they’re’
or the word t-h-e-r-e, the other word ‘there’.
So please don’t get those confused.

Now I know all of this sounds very hard, but
if you practice with me, I’m sure you’ll
So let’s move on to the next part.
Now, here I have a marker.
So, I have to say, “This is my marker.”
Okay, let’s look at this boy.
So, I have to say, “This is his hat.”
And this girl has a dress.

Okay, in this picture there’s an animal;
a dog…and it has a ball.
I have to say, “This is its ball.”
Now, in this picture, we have two people.
Okay, and they both own this house.

Okay, now a little bit farther away, we have
three books.
And this boy and girl have the books here.

So, we have to say “those” and because
we have more than one, we have to use ‘are’.
So we say, “This is our country.”

Okay, let’s move on to the next part for
some more practice.
Okay, here are some practice sentences.

We’re going to put possessive adjectives
on these lines.

“I put candy in ……” What should we
put?
John is one man or boy.
Okay, for one man or boy, we say, “his”.
Okay, let’s look at some more examples.
Okay, we have two people, Paul and Sam.
So I have to say, “Can I use…your phone?”
Well, usually girls or women wear make-up.

So, I’m going to say, “Her make-up looks
good.”
Okay, these are the videos that we make.
We teach English in these videos.
or we sure hope they are.

Okay, so in this video, we learned how to
use possessive adjectives.

Don’t forget you have to put a noun after
each one.

I hope you understand and I hope to see you
in the next video.

In this video, we’re going to learn about
possessive pronouns.

And we use possessive pronouns to show that
something belongs to us
or something is owned by us.
So, let’s take a look at the board.

In this video, we’re going to talk about
the articles; ‘a’, ‘an’ and ‘the’.

Now this can be very confusing, so please
make sure you pay careful attention.
We use articles in front of nouns.

Okay, so remember that and let’s look at
the board.

First, we use ‘a’ or ‘an’ when we’re
talking about any one thing.

For example, let’s say I say, “A banana
is delicious.”

If I’m talking about a specific banana…maybe
I have a banana in my hand.
It’s specific, not any banana, this one.

I have to use ‘the’,
“The banana is old.”
I can’t say, “A banana is old.”
Then that means all bananas are old.
So, I say, “The banana is old.”

We also use ‘a’ or ‘an’ when we’re
talking about something for the first time.
So, I have another example here.

I’m talking about this movie for the first
time, so I have to use “…a movie”.

But, if I want to talk about this movie again,
for the second time, or the third time or
I can’t say, “A movie was fun.”
That means all movies are fun.

Okay, and I also use ‘the’ when I’m
talking about a noun where there’s only
For example, there’s only one sun.

Okay, when I look at the sky, there’s only
one sun.

When there’s one and only, we say, “The
sun.”
Let’s look at some more examples.
The first example says, “A lion is dangerous.”

I have to use ‘a’ because I’m talking

I’m talking about this dog for the first

Now, I’m talking about this dog for the

Well, I used ‘an’ because we have ‘ant’,

Now, I’m talking about this ant again.

I have to say, “the moon” because there’s
